content: Bank Account Credit Card General Asked by AnonymousAsked on 22 Jul 2018Where to park $50K spare cash?Which high interest no frills (eg salary credit...)saving ac should I get if I am thinking of parking $50K? Was thinking of Citi maxi gain (just put and forget). Anyone currently using it?  Some would say park in ssb but may not be allocated all $50K if apply right?9 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (9)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018You can choose to park money in SSB, Fixed Deposits, bonds, or a high interest savings account :)​You can read up on this article by Seedly to know how to park your money with SSB: https://blog.seedly.sg/guide-investing-singapore-savings-bond-ssb-interest-rate-how-to-buy/0 comments1

Jay Liu, Diploma in Accountancy  at KHEALevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018Park in CIMB fastsaver. Interest transfer it to another account.  You can consider maxigain too. For SSBs part, you can apply 5k for every months issue till you used up all 50k(around 10months)  and if you have some more spare, invest in that another 2 months. So you can have double coupon repayment every month. Some may say 6 months will be enough for every month to have coupon repayments. But if you have more spare cash, why not. And since now SSBs are oversubscribed so the allocation are pretty less one can get per months issue. 0 comments1

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018I'm been using maxi gain since last October and I just leave my funds there untouched to earn the bonus interest. If you are gonna set up salary crediting into this account, it may not be a good idea as you need to ensure that the lowest balance in current month is equal or higher than lowest balance in previous month.. 0 comments1
HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 15 Sep 2018CIMB FastSaver 1% p.a without conditiona and just nice up to 50k0 comments1

Jeff Yeo,   amateur Social contributor  at School of social sharingLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018I would focus on a more rounded approach and go with accounts and credit cards like DBS Mulitplier or UoB one account. This would encompass both a savings element and a credit card spending element. ​Both allows for higher interest on the 50k 0 comments1
Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 24 Jul 2018Can consider parking it in CIMB Fastsaver, 1% interest. Can consider using some money for investments too, RSP to buy ETFs or robo etc.0 comments0

Kenneth LouLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 23 Jul 2018Yeah for me I would highly recommend the CIMB FastSaver 1% p.a no-frills. Best part is for up to 50k, so just nice for you haha.​You can read more reviews here: https://seedly.sg/reviews/savings-accounts/cimb-fast-saver​The other is the SSB.0 comments0

Isabella JoLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 22 Jul 2018Citibank Maxigain. Will yield you 1.2% then step up monthly to 2.4% (based on current sibor). However if you withdraw the principal, your counter will drop. For no frills 1% per annum interest is CIMB fast saver.SSB so far only allocates around 12k. So you need 4-5 months to fully allocate 50k. However ssb is long term 10 years. 0 comments0
Good Day Every DayLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018CIMB FastSaver. Earn 1% interest. 0 comments0
